answers.answer: This is a complicated problem since it involves both the urinary and digestive tract.The increased defecation may be solved by placing your dog on a low residue diet available from your veterinarian.  Since he is a growing puppy you should not limit his food too much.  If he has been neutered he could eat once or twice daily.  No additional snacks should be given until the bowel stabilizes.  A probiotic and digestive enzymes may also help.As far as the urinary problem is concerned I recommended that you have a urinalysis performed to check for a urinary tract infection, diabetes, or, other abnormalities.  At least start there.  Additional tests may be necessary to check for kidney function abnormalities,  hormonal problems such as Addison's disease, and others problems.

title: drinking alot of water
